item.description:
Whatta ya think... with the new snow and cold weather finally blessing our region, it's about time we got it in gear and tested our gear... that as winter finally settles in around the mountain regions, we shouldn't let it settle in around our lower regions... or that it's about time we hopped in our cars and drove to the near perfect winter weather proving grounds we call Monadnock, to test the limits of our gear and our fear.

The Hike
(trail map)

With this in mind, I have two hikes in mind. The first (my near all-time favorite) has us car spotting at Gilson Pond, driving over to and hiking up the Dublin Trail, descending along the Pumpelly & Cascade Link Trails, and returning to our cars via the Birchtoft Trail... that is if the road to the Dublin Trailhead is open. A simple point to point hike that arguably includes the most beautiful/scenic trails on Monadnock. If not, then I'm thinking we can start our hike at HQ after spotting a car or two at Gilson, and hike up the White Dot or White Cross Trails (should the park rangers not advise us to not hike the trails). We'll then return by way of the Pumpelly/Cascade/Birchtoft Trails; a fine fine alternative, particularly if the mountain has a fair amount of snow, and the roads to the western trailheads are closed.

As with all trails on Monadnock, there will be scrambling, less so should we take the Dublin up. Regardless of how we get there, once at the summit, we'll enjoy a good bit of teeth chattering and laughter before settling down to some lunch in a most beautiful nook just off the summit. After lunch, we'll begin our descent along the mountain's ridgeline, continuing along the Pumpelly Trail, taking in view after view before making our way below treeline via the Cascade Link trail. We’ll then continue thru a mixed hardwood forest along a progressively flattening Birtchtoft Trail until we reach the Gilson Pond entrance and our cars.

As always, be prepared for changes of temperature and strong winds on the summit. Dress in layers and have plenty of insulation, water, food, and something warm to drink. We will hike at a steady moderate pace, punctuated by short breaks so that we don’t cool off and become chilled. Finally, expect temps at or below freezing. Headlamps, MICROspikes and/or other traction devices will be required. Pets are not permitted (park rules).

Note: We'll be paying close attention to weather and trail conditions, and should there be any adverse weather conditions, such as high winds at the summit or an approaching storm, or should trail conditions prove to be more difficult than anticipated, it may be necessary for us to avoid the summits, alter our plans, or cancel the hike altogether.


don't forget the gnome

EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST

Cold Weather/Winter Essentials (required):
• Synthetic or Wool Wicking Underpant & Undershirt
• Mid-layer Synthetic or Wool Insulating Pant & Shirt
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket and/or Vest
• Windproof/Waterproof Shell w/hood & Pant
• Synthetic or Wool Sock Liners (wicking layer)
• Synthetic or Wool Socks (insulating layer)
• Sturdy Hiking Boots (waterproof)
• Hat & Gloves
• Extra Insulating Layers (pant & top)
• Extra pair of Socks, Hat & Gloves
• Balaclava
• Goggles
• Water (min. 2L) - in a wide-mouthed bottle
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)
• Map/Compass/Whistle
• Headlamp/Flashlight (w/ fresh lithium batteries)
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's no reason not to carry one)
• MICROspikes or similar traction devices (not Yaktrax)

the Remaining Essentials:
• Medication/First Aid Supplies
• Hand Warmers
• Gaiters
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

Optional:
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellent/Toiletries
• Trekking Poles (very helpful when using snowshoes)
• Snowshoes
• Sleeping Pad
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter/Bivy
• Camera/Binoculars

As always, Let's not underestimate anything, come prepared for cold cold temps., wet or snowy weather, early darkness and lots of wind.


 

Directions

From the NH Rt 124/202 intersection in Jaffrey, follow 124 west for approx. 2 miles. Turning right on to Dublin Rd., continue past the park's main entrance until you reach the Gilson Pond entrance on the left (approx. 1.5 miles past HQ). We’ll car spot here and continue to the Dublin trailhead (map) on Old Troy Rd, or head back up the street to the main entrance, from which we will begin our hike.

Google maps: http://maps.google.com/maps?q=585+Dublin+Rd...

Coordinates: 42°51.736'N 72°3.771'W


Additional Information

Mount Monadnock: 3165 feet
Distance: approx. 6.7 miles
Elevation Gain (total): approx. 1800 ft
Exposure: Full @ the summit

Difficulty: Moderate/Strenuous
Pace: Moderate
Hike Time (including stops): 6+ hrs

Sunrise: 7:19 a.m.
Sunset: 4:29 p.m.

Approx. High Temps: high 20's
Approx. Low Temps: mid-teens

10-Day Weather Outlook:
http://www.weather.com/weather/tenday/Monadnock+State+Park+NH+NHSPMO:13:US

7-Day National Weather Forecast (NOAA):
http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php

Current Trail Conditions/Reports:
http://www.mount-monadnock.com/trail_reports.shtml
http://blog.nhstateparks.org/category/monadnock-trail-report/

Mt. Monadnock/Franklin Pierce Web Cam:
http://www.franklinpierce.edu/webcam_monadnock/


Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: From the NH Rt 124/202 intersection in Jaffrey, follow 124 west for approx. 2 miles, turn right on to Dublin Rd. & drive approx. 1.5 miles past the State Park main entrance; the Gilson Pond entrance will be on your left. Cell phone: 860-460-1500
item.name: Winter Tryouts @ Grand Monadnock
